mav_sim.chap12.path_planner module¶

path planner for mavsim_python

mavsim_python

  • Beard & McLain, PUP, 2012

  • Last updated:

    4/3/2019 - BGM

class mav_sim.chap12.path_planner.PathPlanner¶

Bases: object

Path planning object

update(world_map: MsgWorldMap, state: MsgState, end_pose_in: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]] | None = None, planner_type: int = 3, desired_airspeed: float = 25.0, desired_altitude: float = 100.0) → MsgWaypoints¶

Creates a plan based upon the current map, mav state, and minimum radius

Raises a ValueError if the starting and ending points are invalid (i.e., below ground level, in city limits)

Parameters:

  • world_map – definition of the world for planning

  • state – latest mav state

  • end_pose – 3x1 or 4x1 vector giving the desired end location. 3x1 for straight line 4x1 for dubins where final element is the end orientation

  • desired_airspeed – Airspeed to assign to the waypoints

  • desired_altitude – The alitude that the aircraft should maintain

Returns:

resulting plan

Return type:

waypoints

Bases: object

Defines the planner to be used

rrt_dubins = 4¶
